intro: Bergia verticillata, commonly known as the clustered Bergia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are arranged in whorls, giving it a distinctive appearance, and it produces small, pale flowers that bloom in spring. Bergia verticillata is often cultivated in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
